採.definition: to pick; to pluck; to collect; to select; to choose; to gather

採光.definition: to get natural light (e.g. through a window)

採取.definition: to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action); to take

採取措施.definition: to adopt measures; to take steps

採取行動.definition: to take action; to adopt policies; to move on some issue

採擇.definition: to choose and use; to adopt (a decision)

採景.definition: to choose a location; to frame a shot (for filming, photography etc)

採煤.definition: coal mining; coal extraction; coal cutting

採用.definition: to adopt; to employ; to use

採耳.definition: to remove earwax with an ear pick

採花.definition: to pick flowers; to enter houses at night in order to rape women

採行.definition: to adopt (a system, policy, strategy etc)

採製.definition: to gather and process (herbs etc); (of a reporter) to gather material and put together (a recorded news item)

採訪.definition: to interview; to gather news; to hunt for and collect; to cover

採買.definition: to purchase; to buy; to do one's shopping; purchasing agent; buyer

採購.definition: to procure (for an enterprise etc); to purchase

採辦.definition: to buy on a considerable scale; to purchase; to procure; to stock up

採集.definition: to gather; to collect; to harvest

採風.definition: to collect local cultural material (recording folk songs, taking photos etc)

採食.definition: to forage; to gather for eating; to pick and eat
